metadata.Title: CVE-2022-38177 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
By spoofing the target resolver with responses that have a malformed ECDSA signature, an attacker can trigger a small memory leak. It is possible to gradually erode available memory to the point where named crashes for lack of resources.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-38177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.11
bind9-dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.11
bind9-host - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.11
bind9-libs - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.11
bind9-utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.11
bind9utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.11
dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.11
No subscription required
